Entities.Name: Ischaemic stroke
Entities.Definition: A type of stroke identified in brain imaging reports, indicated by reduced blood flow to the brain.

Sample Data.Sentence: The scan revealed evidence of an acute ischaemic stroke in the left hemisphere.

Entities.Name: Haemorrhagic stroke
Entities.Definition: Stroke caused by bleeding within the brain, as identified in radiology reports.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient exhibits signs of a haemorrhagic stroke with midline shift.

Entities.Name: Microbleed
Entities.Definition: Small, chronic blood leaks observable in brain scans, relevant to evaluating stroke risk and cerebral health.

Sample Data.Sentence: Multiple cerebral microbleeds are noted, indicative of possible amyloid angiopathy.

Entities.Name: Tumour
Entities.Definition: Any neoplastic growths or masses identified in the brain through imaging.

Sample Data.Sentence: The MRI shows a 4 cm glioma in the right frontal lobe.
Sample Data.Annotated: Tumour: glioma, 4 cm, right frontal lobe

Entities.Name: Subdural haematoma
Entities.Definition: An accumulation of blood on the surface of the brain, often appearing as a dark mass on imaging reports.

Sample Data.Sentence: There is a subdural haematoma measuring 2 cm causing compression.

Dataset.Name: Edinburgh Stroke Study Radiology Reports
Dataset.Details: A collection of 1168 radiology reports used to train the EdIE-R system for identifying various types of strokes and related conditions in brain imaging.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Annotations involve identifying and linking medical conditions like strokes or tumours to their characteristics such as type, location, and size using a combination of rule-based and machine learning techniques. Specific guidelines include the use of negation detection and relation extraction to improve the specificity of the information extracted.
